perturbation.original_text: Agent shall not be liable for any action taken, suffered or omitted by it or for any error of judgment made by it in the performance of its duties under this Agreement. In no event will Agent be liable for special, indirect, incidental, consequential or punitive losses or damages of any kind whatsoever (including but not limited to lost profits), even if Agent has been advised of the possibility of such losses or damages and regardless of the form of action.
perturbation.changed_text: Service Provider shall not be liable for any action taken, suffered or omitted by it or for any error of judgment made by it in the execution of its responsibilities under this Contract. In no event will the Transfer Agent be liable for special, indirect, incidental, consequential or punitive losses or damages of any kind whatsoever (including but not limited to lost profits), even if Agent has been advised of the possibility of such losses or damages and regardless of the form of action.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'Agent' consistently in the context of liability. The modified text uses 'Service Provider' and 'Transfer Agent' to refer to the same entity, creating ambiguity and potentially conflicting interpretations of liability. The term Contract is also used intead of Agreement, which adds to the contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: Agent may conduct a more in-depth search for the purpose of (i) locating lost stockholders for whom a new address is not obtained in accordance with clause (a) above, (ii) identifying stockholders who are deceased (or locating their next of kin) and (iii) locating stockholders whose accounts contain two or more consecutive uncashed checks, in each case using the services of a locating service provider selected by Agent. Such provider may compensate Agent for processing and other services that Agent provides in connection with such in-depth search.
perturbation.changed_text: The Transfer Agent may conduct a more in-depth search for the purpose of (i) locating missing shareholders for whom a new address is not obtained in accordance with clause (a) above, (ii) identifying shareholders who are deceased (or locating their next of kin) and (iii) locating shareholders whose accounts contain two or more consecutive uncashed checks, in each case using the services of a locating service provider selected by the Service Provider. Such provider may compensate the Agency for processing and other services that Agent provides in connection with such in-depth search.
perturbation.explanation: The original text consistently uses 'Agent' and 'stockholders.' The modified text introduces 'Transfer Agent,' 'missing shareholders,' 'Service Provider,' and 'Agency' to describe what seems like the same entities and people, respectively, creating confusion as to which entity is responsible for which aspects of the search and compensation.

perturbation.original_text: Client acknowledges that Agent is subject to the customer identification program ("Customer Identification Program") requirements under the USA PATRIOT Act and its implementing regulations, and that Agent must obtain, verify and record information that allows Agent to identify Client. Accordingly, prior to accepting an appointment hereunder, Agent may request information from Client that will help Agent to identify Client, including without limitation Client's physical address, tax identification number, organizational documents, certificate of good standing, license to do business, or any other information that Agent deems necessary. Client agrees that Agent cannot accept an appointment hereunder unless and until Agent verifies Client's identity in accordance with the Customer Identification Program requirements.
perturbation.changed_text: Client acknowledges that the Service Provider is subject to the customer identification program ("Customer Identification Program") requirements under the USA PATRIOT Act and its implementing regulations, and that the Firm must obtain, verify and record information that allows the Agency to identify the Customer. Accordingly, prior to accepting an appointment hereunder, the Service Provider may request information from the Customer that will help the Bank to identify the Customer, including without limitation Customer's physical address, tax identification number, organizational documents, certificate of good standing, license to do business, or any other information that the Service Provider deems necessary. Client agrees that the Service Provider cannot accept an appointment hereunder unless and until the Bank verifies Customer's identity in accordance with the Customer Identification Program requirements.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the 'Agent' identifies the 'Client.' The modified text uses 'Service Provider,' 'Firm,' 'Agency,' and 'Bank' interchangeably in place of 'Agent,' and 'Customer' in place of 'Client.' This muddles who is responsible for identifying whom, as well as which entity the 'Client' is dealing with.
